title: Modeling and Inquiry-Based Learning Design for Understanding Acoustic Properties of Materials

context.prior_knowledge: Wave theory in basic physics and mathematical data analysis skills
context.additional_context: Learners collect experimental data and perform mathematical modeling using digital devices, receiving continuous feedback through formative assessments

learning_goals: Learners can quantitatively measure the acoustic properties of various materials and analyze them using data visualization tools.
Learners can express and predict energy attenuation phenomena in sound transmission processes using mathematical models.
Learners can build a logical explanation model comparing the sound absorption and reflection rates of materials based on experimental results.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
